caption: Figure 1: Performance of π⁺ for GABP, APGA, and OGA with full and noisy feedback in the random payoff and hard concave-convex games, respectively. The shaded area represents the standard errors. Note that we report the gap function for the random payoff game, while the tangent residual is reported for the hard concave-convex game.
description: This figure compares the performance of three algorithms: GABP, APGA, and OGA, in two types of games: random payoff games and hard concave-convex games.  Each game type is tested under full feedback and noisy feedback conditions.  The plots show the convergence rate (measured by the gap function for random payoff games and the tangent residual for hard concave-convex games) over iterations.  Shaded areas represent the standard error of the results.

caption: Figure 2: Dynamic regret for GABP, APGA, and OGA with full and noisy feedback.
description: This figure compares the dynamic regret of three algorithms (GABP, APGA, and OGA) under two feedback settings (full and noisy).  The dynamic regret measures how much worse an algorithm performs compared to the best strategy in hindsight.  The plot shows the dynamic regret against the number of iterations, enabling a direct comparison of the algorithms' performance and stability in both full and noisy feedback environments.  The results indicate the relative efficiency and robustness of the algorithms in handling noisy information.
